summary: This bill, the VA Home Loan Program Reform Act, amends Title 38 of the United States Code to address home loan defaults guaranteed by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. It authorizes the Secretary to take actions to prevent foreclosure, including paying holders of loans and obtaining secured interests. It also establishes a Partial Claim Program, allowing the Secretary to purchase a portion of defaulted loans to assist veterans. The bill outlines guidelines for these programs, sets deadlines, and mandates reporting on strategies related to real estate representation for veterans.
